content.raw:
Great that this is all that's needed to compile with Catalina!

Having this information up-top feels a bit intrusive to me though. From what step are these changes needed? Is it from `colcon build` or do they only make a difference at runtime? I suggest we move it to where it is needed.

It would also be good to list clear commands that the user can run to apply those diffs (i.e. `sudo patch ...`), because a beginner wouldn't know what to do with these diffs.

@{5d15084bf46aa30c271ca029} , may also have some suggestions.
content.html:
Great that this is all that's needed to compile with Catalina!

Having this information up-top feels a bit intrusive to me though. From what step are these changes needed? Is it from colcon build or do they only make a difference at runtime? I suggest we move it to where it is needed.

It would also be good to list clear commands that the user can run to apply those diffs (i.e. sudo patch ...), because a beginner wouldn't know what to do with these diffs.

@MaryaB , may also have some suggestions.
